alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:21PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fergus County through 245 PM MDT... At 221 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southeast of Lewistown, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grass Range, Heath and Forestgrove. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 85 and 123. Highway 191 between mile markers 27 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for central Montana.
